intro: Lomaria violacea, commonly known as the violet lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its violet-blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lomaria violacea is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
